Got a good deal on this game during the Holiday 2013 Steam Sale, I got it for $20 including Bioshock 1 & 2 plus got the season pass for the DLC for $5. I'm looking forward to playing this, heard some good reviews about it and even a good candidate to Game of the Year of 2013.

*Edit*

Finally got around to finishing the game, along with the Burial at Sea DLC's. The story was great, and the gameplay was fun. I definitely recommend getting the game + DLC on sale and playing it.

Bioshock infinite, è il terzo capitolo uscito della saga, ma è un titolo a se stante , non ha alcun collegamento con i capitoli precedenti , tranne un piccolo cameo di rapture, ma non voglio fare spoiler.
La nuova città della nostra avventura sarà Columbia la città volante, anno 1912. Pozioni che ti donano poteri torrette automatiche e robottoni ... bhe uno spettacolo...
Il comparto tecnico non è molto variato, a differenza del primo capitolo non avremo le sorelline da salvare o da consumare per avere l'adam, quest'ultimo è stato sostituito dai sali , facilmente reperibili, al nostro fianco avremo Elizabeth una ragazza che dovremo far scappare dalla sua prigionia , dotata di un potere che le permette di aprire delle " finestre" su altri mondi, inoltre ci sarà molto utile e creerà pochi problemi in quanto durante li scontri non la dovremo proteggere dato che è in grado di badare a se stessa in piu raccoglierà munizioni, soldi , sali e medikit per darci una mano, e in caso di morte sarà lei a tirarci su.
La trama è molto intricata, ho fatto fatica a seguirla, sopratutto il finale, ho capito poco e niente ma sono rimasto moolto affascinato, la cosa che invece mi ha lasciato un po deluso e che in questo capitolo mancano i finali alternativi.Si ci saranno scelte da fare durante la storia ma non influisce su di essa piu di tanto.
Il gameplay è molto vario e abbastanza divertente, raramente mi sono annoiato, molto simile ai precedenti ma poco migliorato.
Un gioco veramente consigliato.

I don't even know where to start when talking about this game. I'll try my best for not to spoil you anything about the storyline here but since it is incredibly well planned and made.. I have to mention something atleast. I also want to keep this short but it'll be quite impossible.

When we talk avout BioShock games in general they always contain way too much pointless shooting and Plasmid/Vigor actoin. I can't figure out why but in Infinite this didin't bother me at all. 

Now that I got that off my mind lets talk about the beauty of this game. 
-When you walk in to Rapture everything is already messed up. But when you arrive to Columbia you actually experience a whole another world that is alive and well! Or atleast was doing well until our hero Booker DeWitt shows up..

Let me skip to the ending.. After all the pointless shootings (Yes, it did bother me at some points..) and a stupidly annoying final battle the ending washes that all away. It basically gives you the answer for the entire BioShock universe. 

Buy it. I can't recommend this enough.

Excelente jogo de ação em primeira pessoa!
"BioShock" apresentou um game de tiro em primeira pessoa intenso e gratificante. "Infinite" segue na mesma linha, apresentando um vasto arsenal de pistolas, metralhadoras, escopetas, lançadores de foguetes e outros tantos armamentos.
Além do mais, "BioShock Infinite" se lança a explorar temas complicados e polêmicos, como racismo, religião e herança genética, colocando ainda no pacote uma boa dose de ficção científica, com dimensões paralelas e viagens no tempo, mas ao final amarra tudo de forma incrível e chocante.
BRUTAL, le dejo mis dies.
Nice, very nice =)

This game competely blew mind.....

To be completely honest, I didnt think much of the Bioshock games, but after playing this my thoughts have been changed severely. This game is simply amazing, the story is fantastic to say the least just so engaging, the visuals are finominal and the characters are greatly done.

I greatly recommend this game even if you havent played the other games, the experience that this game gives to the player is simply awesome.

HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.
The original Bioshock was fresh air to action games and, its originality was very well welcome.
Bioshock 2 was more of the same and, bored me a lot.
Fortunatelly this third release of Bioshock is so original as the first one.
Even that it shares some basic aspects, the world is way huger, detailed and surprising.
Those floating houses or parts of map are a very original idea.
The clamp to fly between areas is also very interesting.
No more Big Dads. New enemies, new tactics.
More freedom to move around the world, optional quests, etc.
VERY INTERESTING ENDING.
BEST BIOSHOCK UP TO NOW, IMHO.

На этот раз мы посетим город, парящий в небесах, в котором чистота, порядок и никакой преступности, а царь и бог, который знает как надо жить - один лишь человек (довольно таинственная личность). 
Игра безумно красива и поражает своими локациями глаз.
Сюжет, поначалу разворачивающийся довольно вяло, в процессе обильно сдабривается остреньким,а в конце вообще бьёт по голове носком с мелочью.
Как шутер - тоже весьма не плохо, хотя боевая система уже малость поднадоела.
А вот всякие миниигры, которые в обилии присутствовали в прошлых частях и сильно надоедали к концу игры, в этой части отсутствуют.

В общем:
Кто-то боготворит, кто-то плюётся, а я просто прошел дважды. Хотя такого игры удосуживаются очень редко.
Конечно, если хочется настоящего испытания - включайте сложность 1990, иначе это скорее интерактивная история, а не сложный и интересный шутер.
Goooood !

This is my personal choice for Game of the Year 2013. If you have a powerful enough rig to max out the settings on this game, it looks absolutely incredible. One of the best looking games to date. The gameplay is extremely fun, with many options for you to choose from on how to handle enemies. And the storyline.. oh my god, the storyline! Stick with it until the end, and it is one of the most phenomenal, unique, and jaw dropping storylines of all time. This game EARNS a 10/10 rating. This is everthing people look for in a game, with a 'hardcore' difficulty mode dubbed 1999 mode unlocked after completing the game, for that added replay value. Also once you finish this game, you'll understand why playing through it a second time, makes it all the sweeter. A definate own for any true gamer, Bioshock fan or not.

Picked this up on Steam sale with Bioshock 1 and 2. First of all why get rid of when you can save? That instantly gets minus 50 points on my scale of game play ability. O look your game crashed please redo the game from the start.  O look you have a known graphics glitch happen go back 3 hours. O look another crash 2 hours gone. Secondly minus 20 points lack of telling you you are leaving a section of an area and can't back track.  Third minus 30 points unable to have more than 2 weapons, upgrades too expensive, lack of 'tonic' choices like the first two.   This game gets a 10 out of 100 from me and that is me being generous. I also have a high end computer so it is not my PC that is the issue. This game is buggy as all hell and too much 'first person shooter in a hallway for my liking. ' Thankfully Bioshock 1 and 2 made up for the awesome series or I would have felt very ripped off.

its bioshock

This new installment in the Bioshock series brings about a whole new gaming experience. The storyline of this game is engaging and fantastically developed; the dialogue was gripping, sending me from highs to inevitable lows... Along with the great character building and mind-rattling plot twists, this game ushered in a new form of combat. The combat in this game was new and lively; flying through the sky on sky-lines brought a new angle you can use to look at most combat predicaments. I would recommend this game to those who want something new; it is not your average, everyday shooter. This game is not quite as dark as the first two Bioshocks but it is nothing that should be missed. For me, I just pumped through the last half for the first time spending 6 hours looking everywhere and I can honestly say that this is now one of my favorite games; and that ending...wow...

It's an unfortunate truth that in this era there are too few games that combine great gameplay with truly great storytelling. BioShock Infinite is one of these games. Fast paced, varied, and challenging combat neatly ties together what might be the best story of the year. You want to know what happens to the characters. You feel like you actually care.

Excellent game. Must play.

Any true fans of the Bioshock series should make an effort to add this to your game collection. The gameplay stays mostly fresh throughout the game. The use of the skylines, chaining vigors, and the new array of weapons allows you to take out enemies in a vast amout of ways. And the storyline exceeds the feelz felt in the previous games. It is brain teasing and captivating until the very end. And even then you are left with questions and dying to know the rest

Start playing the game, you're some dude who gets forced up into the cloud city Columbia, where the US founding fathers are worshipped, and the founder of the city is made a prophet. Your mission is to find and retrieve this girl, who is locked in this giant monument house thing. Turns out, she can open and close space time rifts. Things start getting crazy. Going through the campaign is a joy, as well as finding and using all the weapons, powers, rifts, and collectibles. Graphics is a huge plus, as I was literally dumbstruck by the amount of detail that was put into this. Rain seeps through the cracks of the pier, light blooms off of appropriate objects, and the particles of the salt recharge machine are glorious. Gameplay is standard run and gun, but you can use vigors to pull enemies in, float them up, electrocute them, light them up, catch their own bullets and throw them back, and skyrails to move wherever they take you and strike from above. I completed this in 10 hours on normal. 1999 mode, which is extra hard, is added after completing the campaign. The sense of scale is amazing, but it can get you lost at times, even though the game is primarily linear. One more downside to this game is that the ending had me questioning if it was an actual ending, I felt that it took the Borderlands 2 ending route, (people who have played both should know what I mean). By all means, buy it, but I'd wait for a sale, as i feel anywhere from $30 to $10 is a good price for the amount of content alone.

I bought this game at a -81% sale and I still regret it. If I had put fire in the money I spent and watched it burned, I still would have enjoyed it one thousand times more than I enjoyed actually playing this game. It's gameplay is horrible. Mouse control is ridiculous, you can't set mouse acceleration properly, you can only enable or disable it. Mouse sensitivity is clucky, since you can't callibrate mouse acceleration. The result is terrible mouse control and horrible aiming. If this weren't enough, there are lots of action events you must use during combat, like a separate key for melee attack, so you have to constantly swap your fingers from WASD to other keyboard keys, like V, J, Z etc... it's as if developers were drunk when they designed this gameplay.
